titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Albert M. (Albert Maurice) Bender Papers, 1871-1948 M0025
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Patricia J. Palmer; machine-readable finding aid created by Steven Mandeville-Gamble

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-08-04T13:25-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, poems, miscellaneous printed material, autographs and a cassette tape. Correspondents include Clara (Clemens) Gabrilowitsch, Una Jeffers, Herbert Klein, Edwin Markham, John O'Shea and Alfred Edward Newton.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Albert Maurice Bender was a book and art collector, philanthropist, and civic leader of San Francisco.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Albert M. (Albert Maurice) Bender Papers, M0025, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Francis P. Farquhar, 1960, Herbert Arthur Klein, 1979, and Mills College, 1987.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.
